Package it.polimi.ingsw.client.GUI

Class ViewGUIController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.client.GUI.ViewGUIController
All Implemented Interfaces:
View, javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class ViewGUIController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable, View
Controller class associated to every scene to manage the GUIView

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addCard​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
    This method is called every time the first player chooses a card until he chooses as many cards as the number of the players and then send the array list of the chosen cards to the server
    void anotherBuild​(int rowWorker, int columnWorker, int indexWorker, boolean isWrongBox, boolean isFirstTime, boolean isSpecialTurn, int clientIndex, int currentPlaying, boolean done)
    This method is used by player with special gods that can move build than once to load the next scene where it is asked to the player if he wants to
    void anotherMove​(int row, int column, int indexWorker, boolean isWrongBox, boolean firstTime, int clientIndex, int currentPlaying, boolean done)
    This method is used by player with special gods that can move more than once to load the next scene where it is asked to the player if he wants to
    void areYouSure​(int row1, int column1, int row2, int column2, int indexWorker, int currentPlaying, int indexClient)
    Method called from the VisitorClient when the ClientHandler receives not for the first time an AskWorkerToMoveEvent message.
    void askBuildBeforeMove​(int indexWorker, int rowWorker, int columnWorker)
    Method called from the VisitorClient when the ClientHandler receives an AskBeforeBuildMove message.
    void askCard​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> cards)
    Method called from the VisitorClient when the ClientHandler receives an AskCard message.

    Method called from the VisitorClient when the ClientHandler receives an Ask3Card message.
    void askNPlayer()
    Method called from the VisitorClient of the first player connected when the ClientHandler receives an AskNPlayer message.
    void askPlayer​(int clientIndex, boolean firstTime)
    Method called from the VisitorClient when the ClientHandler receives an AskPlayer message.
    void askWantToPlay​(AskWantToPlayEvent askWantToPlay)
    Method called from the VisitorClient when the clientHandler received an AskWantToPlay message
    void askWorker​(int row1, int column1, int row2, int column2, int currentPlaying, int clientIndex, boolean firstTime)
    Method called from the VisitorClient when the ClientHandler receives for the first time an AskWorkerToMoveEvent message.
    void back​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
    This method is used to set invisible the Pane that shows the card on which the player has clicked
    void buildMove​(int rowWorker, int columnWorker, int indexWorker, boolean isWrongBox, boolean isFirstTime, boolean isSpecialTurn, int clientIndex, int currentPlaying, boolean done)
    Method used to load a new scene with the updated game field asking where the player wants to build
    void chooseBlock​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
    Method used by the player to choose which block he wants to build
    void chooseCard​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
    This method is used when a player click on the card he chose for himself and then send his choice to the server
    void close()
    Method used to close client when server is not responding
    void closingConnectionEvent​(int indexClient, boolean gameNotAvailable)
    Method used to send to the server the request of closing the connection
    javafx.scene.image.Image getBlock​(int level)
    This method returns the corresponding image of a building level
    void initialize​(java.net.URL url, java.util.ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
    This method is used to set some graphic changes to the scenes loaded before shows them State 2 prints the cards chosen by the previous player State 4 prints the request to initialize workers State 5 prints the request to chose the worker to move State 6 prints the request to confirm the worker to move State 7 prints the request to decide the position to reach State 8 prints the request to decide if building before moving State 9 prints the request to decide if moving again State 10 prints the request to chose the position where build State 11 prints the request to decide if building again Each state after 2 also prints name, state and god's image of the opponent every time they load a new scene from the GUI controller
    void initializeWorker()
    Method called from the VisitorClient when the ClientHandler receives an AskInitializeWorker message.
    void isNotMyTurn​(int clientIndex)
    This method is used when is not the player's turn
    void loadDataPlayer​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
    This method is used to ask name and age to the player and then to send this data to the server when the user click on the buttonDataPlayer Button
    void loadNPlayer​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
    This method is called when the user insert the player number and click the buttonNplayer Button to send to the server the input
    void loserEvent​(int indexClient, java.util.ArrayList<User> updatedUsersArray, boolean someoneWon)
    This method is used to load the scene of losing game
    void moveWorker​(int row, int column, int indexWorker, boolean isWrongBox, boolean firstTime, int clientIndex, int currentPlaying)
    Method called from the VisitorClient when the ClientHandler receives an AskMoveEvent message.
    void otherWorkerToMove​(int row1, int column1, int row2, int column2, int indexWorker, int currentPlaying, int clientIndex)
    Method called from the VisitorClient when the ClientHandler receives the message to move the other worker
    void printHeartBeat​(ObjHeartBeat objHeartBeat)
    Method used to send, using the SendMessageToServer object, a Pong message to the server after received a ping
    void printPossibleBlocks​(int row, int column)
    Method used to show in a specific pane the blocks the player can build in the chosen position
    void selectCard​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
    This method is used to set visible the pane that shows the card, on which the players click, bigger
    void selectPositionInGameField​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
    This method is associated to the click on each button on the game field In based on the variable state it can do different things If the state is 4, it's used to assign a position to each worker and then send this two boxes to the server If the state is 5, it's used to choose which worker the player want to move and the send an ObjWorkerToMove to the server If the state is 7, it's used to chose the position where the user wants to move the worker and send onn ObjMove to the server If the state is 10, it's used to print the possible blocks the user can build after he chooses the position
    void sendWantToPlay​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
    Method used to send to the server a reply to the AskWantToPlayMessage
    void setIndexPlayer​(int indexPlayer)
    Method used to set the the personal index of the player to know if the player can play or must wait his turn and then send an AckPlayer message to reply to the ObjState message
    void setNPlayer​(int nPlayers)
    Method used to set the number of the gamers playing and then send an AckStartGame message to answer to the startGameEvent message
    void setSendMessageToServer​(SendMessageToServer sendMessageToServer)
    Setter method for the SendMessageToServer object
    void shutdown()
    Method to handle window closing
    void someoneWon​(int indexClient)
    This method is used to load the scene of losing game because someone won
    void surePaneNo​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
    This method is associated with a button used to allowed the player to change some choice If the state is 6, when the button is clicked means that the player wants to change the worker to move and it's used to recall the method askWorker to allow the player to make another choice If the state is 8, when the button is clicked means that the player chose to move without build If the state is 9, when the button is clicked means that the player chose to not move again If the state is 11, when the button is clicked means that the player chose to not build again
    void surePaneYes​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
    This method is associated with a button used to ask confirm to some choice of the player If the state is 6, when the button is clicked means that the player is sure about the worker to move chosen and to send an ObjWorkerToMove object to the server If the state is 8, when the button is clicked means that the player chose to build before making a move If the state is 9, when the button is clicked means that the player chose to move again If the state is 11, when the button is clicked means that the player chose to build again
    void updateBoard​(java.util.ArrayList<User> usersArray, Board board, boolean isShowReachable, int currentPlaying, int indexClient, boolean someoneDead)
    Method called from the VisitorClient every time the clientHandler received an updateBoard message to update and load the users state and the actual board situation
    void whoHasLost​(java.util.ArrayList<User> users, Board board, boolean setReachable, int currentPlaying, int indexClient)
    This method is used to load the scene of winning game because someone lost
    void winnerEvent​(int indexClient)
    This method is used to load the scene of winning game
    void youCanPlay()
    Used only in cli view
    void youHaveToWait()
    Used only in cli view

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      public ViewGUIController​(javafx.scene.image.Image image1, javafx.scene.image.Image image2, javafx.scene.image.Image image3, int nPlayers, int state)
      Constructor called with the card scene
      Parameters:
      image1 - first card image
      image2 - second card image
      image3 - third card image
      nPlayers - number of the players
      state - is the current situation

    • ViewGUIController

      public ViewGUIController​(java.util.ArrayList<User> usersArray, int indexClient, Board board, int currentPlayer, int state, boolean someoneDead)
      Constructor used to show for the first time the game field
      Parameters:
      usersArray - is the ArrayList of users taking part to the game
      indexClient - is the index of the client associated with the player
      board - is the object Board describe the game field
      currentPlayer - is the integer index of the gamer playing in this turn
      state - is the current situation
      someoneDead - true if one of the three player is dead

    • ViewGUIController

      public ViewGUIController​(java.util.ArrayList<User> usersArray, int indexClient, int currentPlayer, Board board, Box workerToMove, boolean firstTime, boolean done, boolean specialTurn, int state)
      Constructor used during the player turn
      Parameters:
      usersArray - is the ArrayList of users taking part to the game
      indexClient - is the index of the client associated with the player
      currentPlayer - is the integer index of the gamer playing in this turn
      board - is the object Board describe the game field
      workerToMove - index of the worker to move
      firstTime - is a boolean that indicates if this is the first move tried in this turn
      done - is a boolean used to indicates if the move turn is over
      specialTurn - is a boolean used to identify special moves
      state - is the current situation

    • ViewGUIController

      public ViewGUIController​(int state, boolean firstTime)
      Constructor
      Parameters:
      state - is the current situation
      firstTime - false if there is another player with the same name

      Parameters:
      state - is the current situation

      public void updateBoard​(java.util.ArrayList<User> usersArray, Board board, boolean isShowReachable, int currentPlaying, int indexClient, boolean someoneDead)
      Method called from the VisitorClient every time the clientHandler received an updateBoard message to update and load the users state and the actual board situation
      Specified by:
      updateBoard in interface View
      Parameters:
      usersArray - is the ArrayList of users taking part to the game
      board - is the object Board describe the game field
      isShowReachable - is a boolean that indicates if the printed board has to show the reachable boxes
      currentPlaying - is the integer index of the gamer playing in this turn
      indexClient - is the index of the client associated with the player
      someoneDead - true if one of the three players died

    • askNPlayer

      public void askNPlayer()
      Method called from the VisitorClient of the first player connected when the ClientHandler receives an AskNPlayer message. It's used to ask the number of the players taking part in the game, the number of client the server must wait for before start the game
      Specified by:
      askNPlayer in interface View

      public void selectPositionInGameField​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method is associated to the click on each button on the game field In based on the variable state it can do different things If the state is 4, it's used to assign a position to each worker and then send this two boxes to the server If the state is 5, it's used to choose which worker the player want to move and the send an ObjWorkerToMove to the server If the state is 7, it's used to chose the position where the user wants to move the worker and send onn ObjMove to the server If the state is 10, it's used to print the possible blocks the user can build after he chooses the position

    • askWorker

      public void askWorker​(int row1, int column1, int row2, int column2, int currentPlaying, int clientIndex, boolean firstTime)
      Method called from the VisitorClient when the ClientHandler receives for the first time an AskWorkerToMoveEvent message. It's used to load the scene with the game field updated
      Specified by:
      askWorker in interface View
      Parameters:
      row1 - is the row of the box occupied by the worker 1
      column1 - is the column of the box occupied by the worker 1
      row2 - is the row of the box occupied by the worker 2
      column2 - is the column of the box occupied by the worker 2
      currentPlaying - is the integer index of the player who is playing
      clientIndex - is the integer index associated to the client
      firstTime - indicates if it's the first time the player chooses a worker in the actual turn

    • areYouSure

      public void areYouSure​(int row1, int column1, int row2, int column2, int indexWorker, int currentPlaying, int indexClient)
      Method called from the VisitorClient when the ClientHandler receives not for the first time an AskWorkerToMoveEvent message. It's used to load the scene with the game field updated with a new Pane that asks to the player if he is sure about the worker to move chosen
      Specified by:
      areYouSure in interface View
      Parameters:

      column1 - is the column of the box occupied by the worker 1
      row2 - is the row of the box occupied by the worker 2
      column2 - is the column of the box occupied by the worker 2
      indexWorker - is the integer index of the worker the player wants to move
      currentPlaying - is the integer index of the player who is playing
      indexClient - is the integer index associated to the client

    • surePaneYes

      public void surePaneYes​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method is associated with a button used to ask confirm to some choice of the player If the state is 6, when the button is clicked means that the player is sure about the worker to move chosen and to send an ObjWorkerToMove object to the server If the state is 8, when the button is clicked means that the player chose to build before making a move If the state is 9, when the button is clicked means that the player chose to move again If the state is 11, when the button is clicked means that the player chose to build again
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - is the object associated to the click event

    • surePaneNo

      public void surePaneNo​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method is associated with a button used to allowed the player to change some choice If the state is 6, when the button is clicked means that the player wants to change the worker to move and it's used to recall the method askWorker to allow the player to make another choice If the state is 8, when the button is clicked means that the player chose to move without build If the state is 9, when the button is clicked means that the player chose to not move again If the state is 11, when the button is clicked means that the player chose to not build again
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - is the object associated to the click event

    • askBuildBeforeMove

      public void askBuildBeforeMove​(int indexWorker, int rowWorker, int columnWorker)
      Method called from the VisitorClient when the ClientHandler receives an AskBeforeBuildMove message. It's used to load the scene with the game field updated with a new Pane that asks to the player if he wants to build before move
      Specified by:
      askBuildBeforeMove in interface View
      Parameters:
      indexWorker - is the integer index of the worker the player wants to move
      rowWorker - is the row of the box occupied by the worker
      columnWorker - is the column of the box occupied by the worker

    • moveWorker

      public void moveWorker​(int row, int column, int indexWorker, boolean isWrongBox, boolean firstTime, int clientIndex, int currentPlaying)
      Method called from the VisitorClient when the ClientHandler receives an AskMoveEvent message. It's used to load the scene with the game field updated asking where the player wants to move the chosen worker
      Specified by:
      moveWorker in interface View
      Parameters:
      row - is the starting row of the worker to move
      column - is the starting column of the worker to move
      indexWorker - is the integer index of the worker the player chose to move
      isWrongBox - is a boolean that indicates if the move is wrong
      clientIndex - is the integer index associated to the client
      currentPlaying - is the integer index of the player who is playing
      firstTime - is a boolean that indicates if this is the first move tried in this turn

    • anotherMove

      public void anotherMove​(int row, int column, int indexWorker, boolean isWrongBox, boolean firstTime, int clientIndex, int currentPlaying, boolean done)
      This method is used by player with special gods that can move more than once to load the next scene where it is asked to the player if he wants to
      Specified by:
      anotherMove in interface View
      Parameters:
      row - is the row of the box occupied by the worker
      column - is the column of the box occupied by the worker
      indexWorker - is the integer index of the worker the player wants to move
      isWrongBox - is a boolean that indicates if the move is wrong
      firstTime - is a boolean that indicates if this is the first move tried in this turn
      clientIndex - is the integer index associated to the client
      currentPlaying - is the integer index of the player who is playing
      done - is a boolean used to indicates if the move turn is over

      indexClient - index of the client

    • whoHasLost

      public void whoHasLost​(java.util.ArrayList<User> users, Board board, boolean setReachable, int currentPlaying, int indexClient)
      This method is used to load the scene of winning game because someone lost
      Specified by:
      whoHasLost in interface View
      Parameters:
      users - is the ArrayList of users taking part to the game
      board - is the object Board describe the game field
      setReachable - is a boolean that indicates if the printed board has to show the reachable boxes
      currentPlaying - is the integer index of the player who is playing
      indexClient - index of the client

    • printHeartBeat

      public void printHeartBeat​(ObjHeartBeat objHeartBeat)
      Method used to send, using the SendMessageToServer object, a Pong message to the server after received a ping
      Specified by:
      printHeartBeat in interface View
      Parameters:
      objHeartBeat - is the message Ping received from the visitorClient

    • closingConnectionEvent

      public void closingConnectionEvent​(int indexClient, boolean gameNotAvailable)
      Method used to send to the server the request of closing the connection
      Specified by:
      closingConnectionEvent in interface View
      Parameters:
      indexClient - is the index associated to the client
      gameNotAvailable - is a boolean used to indicate if the connection will be close because the game is already started or because of a problem

    • close

      public void close()
      Method used to close client when server is not responding
      Specified by:
      close in interface View

    • shutdown

      public void shutdown()
      Method to handle window closing

    • getBlock

      public javafx.scene.image.Image getBlock​(int level)
      This method returns the corresponding image of a building level
      Parameters:
      level - is the index of the building level
      Returns:
      the image of the level asked

    • initialize

      public void initialize​(java.net.URL url, java.util.ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      This method is used to set some graphic changes to the scenes loaded before shows them State 2 prints the cards chosen by the previous player State 4 prints the request to initialize workers State 5 prints the request to chose the worker to move State 6 prints the request to confirm the worker to move State 7 prints the request to decide the position to reach State 8 prints the request to decide if building before moving State 9 prints the request to decide if moving again State 10 prints the request to chose the position where build State 11 prints the request to decide if building again Each state after 2 also prints name, state and god's image of the opponent every time they load a new scene from the GUI controller
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - connection to the page to show
      resourceBundle - package of resources of the game
